definition: to walk (side part of split character)
inferior (often in the combination 毫無遜色|毫无逊色, not in the least inferior)

sentences.english: The application of Michelson interference principle in measuring small displacement is introduced.
sentences.chinese: 介绍迈克尔逊干涉仪原理在测微小位移中的应用。

sentences.english: I heard Oistrakh play the Mendelssohn concerto last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚我听了奥斯崔克演奏的孟德尔逊协奏曲。

sentences.english: Mr Gilbertson at Sual has been pursuing a similar aim.
sentences.chinese: 吉尔伯逊也在追求相似的目标。

sentences.english: The third chapter focuses on Richardson's view on female from the aspect of contemporaneous reader's acceptance of the novel.
sentences.chinese: 第三章从作品被读者接受的情况分析理查逊的女性观。

sentences.english: Pearson also predicts a breakthrough in computer-human links.“By
sentences.chinese: 皮尔逊逊预言了电脑与人各种连接的突破。

sentences.english: Billson and Wilson turned and stared at each other.
sentences.chinese: 比尔逊和威尔逊各自转过脸来，四目相对。

sentences.english: On Friday Mr. Gillinson awoke to news of the earthquake.
sentences.chinese: 格林逊先生在星期五醒来时知道地震的消息。

sentences.english: Hello?Peterson Paper Products?This is Terry Wang of Wang Trading.
sentences.chinese: 喂？彼得逊纸厂吗？我是王氏贸易公司的王泰利。

sentences.english: This thesis is about Kelsen's pure theory.
sentences.chinese: 本文主要是介绍和评述凯尔逊的“纯粹法”理论。

sentences.english: A method of measuring gas concentration with Michelson interferometer is presented.
sentences.chinese: 本文介绍用迈克尔逊干涉仪测量气体浓度的一种方法。

sentences.english: Obviously, this chapter of Bell abdicates too optimistically.
sentences.chinese: 显然，这回贝尔逊过于乐观。

sentences.english: Mr. Jamieson offers a few more ideas.
sentences.chinese: 杰米逊先生提供了一些参考意见。

sentences.english: But Bell abdicates hires the wife Libya and US forecast not to make the explicit response regarding this.
sentences.chinese: 但贝尔逊的雇主房利美并没有对此预测作出明确反应。

sentences.english: I have a dog called HARISON that is a he-one with great pride.
sentences.chinese: 我养了一条狗，叫海尔逊，是一条傲气十足的公狗。

sentences.english: We present a method to measure the evanescent field by Michelson interferometer.
sentences.chinese: 提出了一种用迈克尔逊干涉仪探测隐失场的方法。

sentences.english: In 1825, an Englishman called Stiffen invited the train.
sentences.chinese: 一个叫史蒂芬逊的英国人在1825年发明了火车。

definition: father's elder brother/senior/paternal elder uncle/eldest of brothers/respectful form of address/Count, third of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]
to fight with all one's might
Mt Tai in Shandong/same as 泰山
